etymology.description: Depicts a stylized form representing the face/head of a ghost or spirit -> possibly interpreted as a mask in historical texts
etymology.interpretation: 甶(甶) (fú, "ghost head") is depicted as a stylized representation of a face or mask, traditionally seen as a ghost or spirit head. It illustrates the ancient belief in spiritual apparitions that might have been used in rituals.

examples.chinese: 古宅中流传着关于甶的传说(古宅中流傳著關於甶的傳說)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔ zhái zhōng liú chuán zhe guān yú fú de chuán shuō.
examples.english: An old mansion holds a legend about the ghost head.

examples.chinese: 午夜时分阴风乍起(午夜時分陰風乍起)，惊醒了封存已久的甶(驚醒了封存已久的甶)。
examples.pinyin: Wǔyè shí fēn yīn fēng zhà qǐ, jīng xǐng le fēng cún yǐ jiǔ de fú.
examples.english: At midnight, as a sudden gust of wind stirred, it awoke the long-sealed ghost head.
